title: ion-popover
body: A Popover is a dialog that appears on top of the current page. It can be used for anything, but generally it is used for overflow actions that don't fit in the navigation bar.
To present a popover, call the
method on a popover instance. In order to position the popover relative to the element clicked, a click event needs to be passed into the options of the the
method. If the event is not passed, the popover will be positioned in the center of the viewport.
Popover uses scoped encapsulation, which means it will automatically scope its CSS by appending each of the styles with an additional class at runtime. Overriding scoped selectors in CSS requires a
We recommend passing a custom class to
method and using that to add custom styles to the host and inner elements. This property can also accept multiple classes separated by spaces. View the
section for an example of how to pass a class using
/* DOES NOT WORK - not specific enough */
/* Works - pass "my-custom-class" in cssClass to increase specificity */
can be used to style the Popover without needing to target individual elements:
If you are building an Ionic Angular app, the styles need to be added to a global stylesheet file. Read
in the Angular section below for more information.

angular: In Angular, the CSS of a specific page is scoped only to elements of that page. Even though the Popover can be presented from within a page, the
element is appended outside of the current page. This means that any custom styles need to go in a global stylesheet file. In an Ionic Angular starter this can be the
file or you can register a new global style file by

props.name: backdropDismiss
props.docs: If true, the popover will be dismissed when the backdrop is clicked.

props.name: component
props.docs: The component to display inside of the popover.

props.name: componentProps
props.docs: The data to pass to the popover component.

props.name: cssClass
props.docs: Additional classes to apply for custom CSS. If multiple classes are provided they should be separated by spaces.

props.name: enterAnimation
props.docs: Animation to use when the popover is presented.

props.name: event
props.docs: The event to pass to the popover animation.

props.name: keyboardClose
props.docs: If true, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

props.name: leaveAnimation
props.docs: Animation to use when the popover is dismissed.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: showBackdrop
props.docs: If true, a backdrop will be displayed behind the popover.

props.name: translucent
props.docs: If true, the popover will be translucent. Only applies when the mode is "ios" and the device supports backdrop-filter.

methods.name: dismiss
methods.signature: dismiss(data?: any, role?: string | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Dismiss the popover overlay after it has been presented.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: data Any data to emit in the dismiss events.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: role The role of the element that is dismissing the popover. For example, 'cancel' or 'backdrop'.

methods.name: onDidDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the popover did dismiss.

methods.name: onWillDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the popover will dismiss.

methods.name: present
methods.docs: Present the popover overlay after it has been created.

docs: A Popover is a dialog that appears on top of the current page. It can be used for anything, but generally it is used for overflow actions that don't fit in the navigation bar.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

events.docs: Emitted after the popover has dismissed.
Emitted after the popover has presented.
Emitted before the popover has dismissed.
Emitted before the popover has presented.
